newsitem.title: USA: Excite files shelf for 3.3 million shares. [CORRECTED 23:06 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Excite files shelf for 3.3 million shares. [CORRECTED 23:06 GMT]

text.p: (Corrects to make clear shelf is being registered by Excite Inc, and not by American Online.)
Excite Inc filed Wednesday a shelf registration with the Securities and Exchange Commission for up to 3,280,330 shares.

All the shares being registered are held by America Online Inc and may be offered during up to four "permitted windows" which can occur during a period which will start on the date which this registration statement becomes effective and will end on March 27, 1999.
The shares are issuable upon conversion of 1,950,000 shares of preferred stock issued by Excite to AOL in connection with an asset acquisition that was consummated on March 27, 1996.

The shares are also issuable upon conversion of 680,330 shares of preferred issued in exchange for an equivalent number of common shares held by AOL Ventures Inc. The shares are also issuable upon conversion of 650,000 shares of preferred issuable upon exercise of a warrant. The total offering equals 21.9 percent of Excite's outstanding common as of March 31, 1997.
Excite, based in California, provides a gateway to the World Wide Web that organizes, aggregates and delivers information to meet the needs of individual customers.
